body_html:
To be honest, the time consuming is normal without DataLoader.

if __name__ == "__main__":
      celeba = CelebADataset('Bangs', 1)
      for i in range(64*10):
    	    print(i)
    	    print(celeba[i])

I supposed to speed up the data provider using DataLoader, since it uses multi-process. However, it seems worse. The problem may due to the transforming images to Tensor operation. I am not sure.

body:
To be honest, the time consuming is normal without DataLoader.

```
if __name__ == "__main__":
      celeba = CelebADataset('Bangs', 1)
      for i in range(64*10):
    	    print(i)
    	    print(celeba[i])
```

I supposed to speed up the data provider using DataLoader, since it uses multi-process. However, it seems worse. The problem may due to the transforming images to Tensor operation. I am not sure.
